verses.plain: I cried unto God with my voice, even unto God with my voice; and he gave ear unto me.

tokens.t: I cried unto God with my voice,
unto God with my voice; and he gave ear unto me.

verses.plain: In the day of my trouble I sought the Lord: my sore ran in the night, and ceased not: my soul refused to be comforted.

tokens.t: In the day of my trouble I sought the Lord: my sore ran in the night, and ceased not: my soul refused to be comforted.

verses.plain: I remembered God, and was troubled: I complained, and my spirit was overwhelmed. Selah.

tokens.t: I remembered God, and was troubled: I complained, and my spirit was overwhelmed. Selah.

verses.plain: Thou holdest mine eyes waking: I am so troubled that I cannot speak.

tokens.t: Thou holdest mine eyes waking: I am so troubled that I cannot speak.

verses.plain: I have considered the days of old, the years of ancient times.

tokens.t: I have considered the days of old, the years of ancient times.

verses.plain: I call to remembrance my song in the night: I commune with mine own heart: and my spirit made diligent search.

tokens.t: I call to remembrance my song in the night: I commune with mine own heart: and my spirit made diligent search.

verses.plain: Will the Lord cast off for ever? and will he be favourable no more?

tokens.t: Will the Lord cast off for ever? and will he be favourable no more?

verses.plain: Is his mercy clean gone for ever? doth his promise fail for evermore?

tokens.t: Is his mercy clean gone for ever? doth
promise fail for evermore?

verses.plain: Hath God forgotten to be gracious? hath he in anger shut up his tender mercies? Selah.

tokens.t: Hath God forgotten to be gracious? hath he in anger shut up his tender mercies? Selah.

verses.plain: And I said, This is my infirmity: but I will remember the years of the right hand of the most High.

tokens.t: And I said, This
my infirmity:
the years of the right hand of the most High.

verses.plain: I will remember the works of the LORD: surely I will remember thy wonders of old.

tokens.t: I will remember the works of the
: surely I will remember thy wonders of old.

verses.plain: I will meditate also of all thy work, and talk of thy doings.

tokens.t: I will meditate also of all thy work, and talk of thy doings.

verses.plain: Thy way, O God, is in the sanctuary: who is so great a God as our God?

tokens.t: Thy way, O God,
in the sanctuary: who
great a God as
God?

verses.plain: Thou art the God that doest wonders: thou hast declared thy strength among the people.

tokens.t: Thou
the God that doest wonders: thou hast declared thy strength among the people.

verses.plain: Thou hast with thine arm redeemed thy people, the sons of Jacob and Joseph. Selah.

tokens.t: Thou hast with
arm redeemed thy people, the sons of Jacob and Joseph. Selah.

verses.plain: The waters saw thee, O God, the waters saw thee; they were afraid: the depths also were troubled.

tokens.t: The waters saw thee, O God, the waters saw thee; they were afraid: the depths also were troubled.

verses.plain: The clouds poured out water: the skies sent out a sound: thine arrows also went abroad.

tokens.t: The clouds poured out water: the skies sent out a sound: thine arrows also went abroad.

verses.plain: The voice of thy thunder was in the heaven: the lightnings lightened the world: the earth trembled and shook.

tokens.t: The voice of thy thunder
in the heaven: the lightnings lightened the world: the earth trembled and shook.

verses.plain: Thy way is in the sea, and thy path in the great waters, and thy footsteps are not known.

tokens.t: Thy way
in the sea, and thy path in the great waters, and thy footsteps are not known.

verses.plain: Thou leddest thy people like a flock by the hand of Moses and Aaron.

tokens.t: Thou leddest thy people like a flock by the hand of Moses and Aaron.

footnotes.text: for evermore: Heb. to generation and generation?
poured…: Heb. were poured forth with water
